com.tacttiles.api

Class Glove

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tacttiles.api.Glove

  • public class Glove
extends java.lang.Object
    A Glove is a hardware abstraction that handles the low level communication protocol used in devices compatibles with the HELENA Glove platform.

    In this class gestures are simplified to letters, which may be composed of a single/double tap (input) or vibration (output).

    High level user-interaction events can be handled by a custom implementation and register of the inner static class Glove.GloveListener.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Glove.GloveListener
      A glove listener receives notifications of new data available in the Glove object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Glove

        public Glove()
        Constructs a glove adapter.

    • Method Detail

      • getDevice

        public Device getDevice()
        Returns the core device of this class. It can be used to access lower level control over the physical device that this adapter class is connected to.
        Returns:
        The core device

      • addListener

        public void addListener(Glove.GloveListener gloveListener)
        Adds a listener to the current set of event listeners of this adapter. Events can be button presses or I/O letter gestures.
        Parameters:
        gloveListener - The listener to be added to the current set of listeners on this adapter.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(Glove.GloveListener gloveListener)
        Removes a listener from the set listening to this adapter.
        Parameters:
        gloveListener - The listener to be removed to the current set of listeners on this adapter.

      • setup

        public void setup(int delayL,
                  int delayW,
                  int singleH,
                  int doubleH,
                  int doubleL)
        Set the default values used while drawing the letter gestures.
        Parameters:
        delayL - Delay in ms between letters, default = 250 ms.
        delayW - Delay in ms between words, default = 250 ms.
        singleH - Single vibration duration in ms, default = 150 ms.
        doubleH - Vibration duration in ms for double tap letters, default = 150 ms.
        doubleL - Delay between vibrations in double tap letters, default = 100 ms.

      • connect

        public void connect(Context appContext)
        Connects this adapter to the Tact-Tiles runtime service, which handles the bluetooth communication and device access.
        Parameters:
        appContext - The current context of this application.

      • setGloveIOMap

        public void setGloveIOMap(int[] map)
        The glove I/O map is a array containing the tile indexes for each of the 26 letters of the alphabet. The sign of the numbers in the array represents the type of gesture, single tap gestures are positive and double tap gestures are negative integers.
        Parameters:
        map - An array containing the tile indexes for each letter of the alphabet.

      • setSpaceChar

        public void setSpaceChar(char spaceChar)
        Set the space character as the inverse gesture of the passed letter. If the input letter gesture is a single tap, the space char input becomes the double tap of the said tile, and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        spaceChar - The new space character, default is 'w'.

      • getLetter

        public char getLetter(int symbol)
        Converts a received symbol into a letter. The symbol follows the map logic, in which a positive integer codes a single tap gesture and a negative, a double tap one.
        Parameters:
        symbol - Symbol coded as a positive or negative tile index.
        Returns:
        The letter as set by the I/O map.

      • getTileId

        public int getTileId(char letter)
        Returns the index of the tile that is used as input for the passed letter.
        Parameters:
        letter - A character in the range of [a - z] or space ' '.
        Returns:
        The index of the I/O tile.

      • buildLetterGestureMessage

        protected java.lang.String buildLetterGestureMessage(char letter)
        Constructs a gesture for the passed letter. The gesture is coded as a string compatible with Device.send(String).
        Parameters:
        letter - a char in the range [97,122] or space ' '.
        Returns:
        array of bytes containing the raw commands for drawing the letter.

      • draw

        public java.lang.Thread draw(java.lang.String text)
        Draws a text as a series of vibration gestures. Each letter can be converted into a single or double tap output gesture, which is sent trough a series of adapters and results in the calling of Glove.GloveListener.onLetterDraw(int, char[]), if everything goes as planed.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to be drawn.
        Returns:
        a non started Thread object that performs the drawing.
